div: Select Tools → Activity Shielding Fit to launch the tool.
In the leftmost box in the tool window, check/uncheck under the "Use" column the peaks you wish to use in determining the activity of the shielding; checked boxes indicate a "false" peak.
Check/uncheck the box next to "Multiple nuclides contribute to peak" located at the bottom left corner of the window to account for cases when two nuclides may be the cause of the same gamma peak.
When peaks from your background spectrum may interfere with your foreground spectrum, check/uncheck the box next to "Subtract Background Peaks" located at the bottom left corner of the window.

To account for more shielding, including advanced cases of shielding, select the Material icon located at the top right of the window to add a shielding source, and select the appropriate material/thickness accordingly. For a material that is not provided under the Material option select the Generic icon, input the "Areal Dens.[ity]" and atomic number.

div.ul: If accounting for shielding here, be sure to check/uncheck the "Fit" box located to the right of each Material or Generic box you wish to be incorporated in your spectrum. This ability allows you to immediately see the effects of a small variance in the shielding source such that you can better determine the accurate choice of shielding material.

div:
You can also "Import Source Shielding XML Model" by hovering the cursor over the settings icon (
)in the top right of the window, and selecting "Upload Model."

No matter what method of inputting shielding is used, be sure to input the distance the measurement was taken from the shielding source in the box next to "Distance" on the top right of the window; it is by default set to 100 centimeters.

div.ul: The application has the ability to identify and adjust the units you input after the numerical figures; you will not need to normalize the units you plan to input.
